item.title: Report E-2024080664
item.description:
Report E-2024080664

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-29T09:23:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: WICHITA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) cup of material was released due to a leaking bung cap. Clean Harbors personnel neutralized the impacted area, replaced the degraded bung cap, and then cleaned the released material. The degraded bung cap and recovered material were placed into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization

item.title: Report E-2024080562
item.description:
Report E-2024080562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 13, 2024, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN17914 was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected one (1) 30-gallon pail of hypochlorite solution into one (1) 55-gallon over pack poly drum. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the hypochlorite solution and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. On August 19, 2024, EWI returned to the site to process the request to transfer the hypochlorite solution material into a closed top drum. EWI transferred the hypochlorite solution from the damaged 30-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080578
item.description:
Report E-2024080578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released affecting an 10’ x 7’ area of the trailer floor. It was determined the bag was torn due to contact with the trailer wall. The contractor collected and containerized the damaged bag of product and cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080582
item.description:
Report E-2024080582

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN1760 SR285 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of material released to a 75' x25' area of the concrete lot as well as the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly and (1) 65-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
